Reviews.Title: “Good location away from Centre with good transport links but average rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: Joey1965
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from the S line station and a bus running from the zoo to Checkpoint Charlie stops within a few yards. However the hotel service was poor and some staff extremely unhelpful when a request for extra pillows on th first night. On our second day the room had still not been cleaned by the time we returned at 4pm. We did not eat in the hotel as breakfast was expensive (not included in room rate) and anyway there are plenty of places to obtain fresh pastries to start the day. As we booked online the hotel room rate was very reasonable for a major city but it was a shame that service issues spoiled our stay. The Purchase of a 72hr Berlin City Card made travel to and from the hotel very reasonable and included the train rides between the airport and the zoo. A further saving was made by buying the travel card on the outbound flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but watch the holidays”
Reviews.Author: Wtlftdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel President around the Easter Holiday. We paid extra to stay in the "President" area, which includes an upgraded room and daily breakfast which is supposed to be available in the top-floor breakfast room (away from the craziness that can accompany breakfast in the main room). Despite the hotel being very busy over the long Easter weekend, the hotel closed the breakfast room for the holiday. This created a significant mess in the main dining room; people standing around waiting for a table was common. While this may seem like a small thing, when you pay extra for a service and it is not provided, it can be very frustrating. Otherwise, it was a nice stay. The room was big by Europe standards and very quiet (due to the upgrade). The front-desk staff is very efficient and not speaking German was not an issue. The bar is a nice area, but they still allow people to smoke in there (ugh). I would stay again, but probably not during a holiday period.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for this price”
Reviews.Author: oleganisimov
Reviews.Content: Free wifi in rooms with limit of 200 mb for session. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ok interiors”
Reviews.Author: e26
Reviews.Content: Berlin was the first stop on my Central Europe trip. Arrived on March 17th from Tegel Airport, airfare to Best Western Hotel President was about 18 euros. The location is in the Western part of the city near Tiergarten and there is a metro stop about a 5 minute walk from the hotel and a late night supermarket (not open on Sundays) around the corner. The location is good, because it's also near a very busy shopping district. It does not seem like it though unless you walk towards it (just head towards the big dept. store KaDeWe). Service wise, the staff was so friendly and warm. They were very helpful in all questions and pleasant. I was a bit disappointed in the room, the size was not a problem but the furniture is definitely a bit dated. Some of the chairs had holes in them, etc. Not a big deal since you're just there to sleep though right?? But of all the hotels on my trip, this was my least fave hotel. However, the price is very good and the hallways and the lobby were fine. There is a spa/gym downstairs in the basement that i did not check out but that's nice to have. They do offer a breakfast buffet but we didn't have it as part of our rsvp. Do NOT go eat in the square by the hotel (only close place with shops/food). Of all the places we went to while we were in Berlin, it was by far the most expensive meal we had. The staff always directed us to go eat near the Nikolaivertel area (close to museum island) for quality German meals at better prices. Also, you will get to know Bus 100, which takes you around the park and up to Potsdam Platz, the Berliner Domer, and Bradenburg gate, in addition to other key touristy sites. The bus stop is around the corner from the hotel on the left side. If I were to go to Berlin again, I'd probably find another place to stay, only because the room wasn't as nice as I thought it would. I noticed right next door, there is a hotel that looked pretty new and modern and chic called Motel One. Prices seem on par with Hotel President, perhaps another option?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with even nicer staff”
Reviews.Author: Jackyboy98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ITB and had a good experience. The rooms are clean, could be more updated but cannot complain. Very good location and very helpful staff. Wifi is also free which is a plus. Staff we tremendous and in particular the gentleman in the lobby bar who went above and beyond his duties to assist us, great service mentality. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Berlin needing a base for either business or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: stamppot
Reviews.Content: Went here for a convention. Room was smallish, with a small bathroom. Everything is logically laid out. Beds are good, firm but comfy. Breakfast is adequate. They offer free Wi-Fi in all rooms, but you have to log in every time.room has been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: s_ramsam
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a reasonably good location in Berlin. Good rooms and quite good service. Good breakfast too. Had a very comfortable stay as part of a visit group for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Ali S
Reviews.Content: Awesome location... within walking distance to the zoo, KaDeWe and a nice shopping district with tons of shops and restaurants. For the most part, staff was friendly. The rooms were nothing special, but perfect for a short stay.Parking was a little pricey, but I guess that's to be expected when traveling in Berlin. I highly recommend this hotel if you are being budget conscious, but still want to experience a lot of things in one small area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you're without a car”
Reviews.Author: traveller65432107
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located about 10 minutes walk from Kurfurstendamn (a lot of bars and restaurants). The rooms are really nice, though there was no mini-fridge and I had to go ask the bartender for ice. We paid less than 50 euros per night, for this price it's a very good value. The parking is really expensive (15 euros per night)...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jutta123
Reviews.Content: Our Hotel was great. It was situated within walking distance of many desirable attractions as well as close to easily understood public transportation. The staff was accomodating, although they had some difficulties understanding our very low prepaid rate, which they questioned but ultimately honored with a lot of grace and appologies for their initial hesitation. Also, the first thing I noticed upon entering our room was the freshly ironed bedlinnen "without day blanket". Those day blankets are usually an obstical to my need for unquestionalble hygene, in a space I want to feel at home, while being a guest. As these can not be laundered as often as a new guest occupies the room, they are usually the first item i fold and store in the closet. This small difference made me feel very comfortable and stimulates me to write this review. Thank you staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “It’s a hotel that caters more for business, but still good for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Woowoo101
Reviews.Content: Coffee/Tea making facilities, Shower above bath, clean and tidy. Beds were extremely soft, too much for my liking, but that’s just a personal preference. No large duvets for the double bed but two smaller separate singal duvets. Strange set-up but still okay. Staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English (actually most of the folk we met in Germany/Poland spoke great English.) Location is good for shopping, restaurants and the metro. Local supermarket around the corner for drinks and snacks should you not wish to use the vending machine in the hotel. Not the place for two weeks with the kids but great for a long weekend away. We decided to use the metro train on a day-pass to get around rather than the bus tours. A little intimidating if you don't speak German but just ask your way and folk are extremely accomodating to help. Start at the East with the Berlin Wall and work your way back jumping off to see the markets, Brandenburg gate and Check-point Charlie. A good day out for the adventurous. The last day we decided to get a train to Frankfurt (oder) that took an hour. A shortish walk over a bridge took us to Poland where we had lunch, a walk along the river then back a few hours later. All-in-all, a great weekend away for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Lilia R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is happily located near the metro station and the shopping area. Friendly staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Good for business and travellers. The only thing I don't like was the bed, especially I was shocked by very small size of blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a good price.”
Reviews.Author: strongma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights while visiting Berlin and was quite pleased with my choice. First let me point out that this hotel is much better than the average Best Western hotel in the United States, like comparing apples to oranges. Upon checking in the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. They gladly gave me advice on local banks, stores and travel options and booked me a ride to the airport upon leaving. The hotel also had a decent restaurant with some of the best duck I’ve had in a long time for a very reasonable price. The room was comfortable and adequate with a decent bed and bathroom, though it wasn’t anything special. It contained a large TV and an empty fridge. Each floor had a vending machine with liquor, beer, wine, soda, water and snacks should you wish to fill up your fridge. The room also had a trouser press and free Wi-Fi Internet access (code obtained from the lobby). Walking distance to the Zoo (many tours and the metro meet up here) was about 10 minutes and very straightforward (only one turn). I enjoyed my stay and the next time I’m in Berlin I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Hello Sirs/Madams, I see your Hotel is my Home in Berlin. Very reasonably priced, excellent location, perfect staff, excellent room and service quality. Whatelse can one expect. I am recommending your Hotel to everybody I know. You are Best of the best. Thanks, Mehmet Türken

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Braveliver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Nov 2011. I found the staff on reception very friendly, and I did not need to wait for checkin or check out. Room was comfortable room and clean, and the hotel is in a reasonable location (15 mins walk to Potsdammer Platz) and lots of other shops and restaurants on adjacent street. All of that for a really good price too. I will certainly return on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good normal standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: Nothing to add that has not been said, but the hotel bar is designated as a smokers bar. If you are elevated to status to go to the presidents bar then you either sit with smokers or go to relax and have a drink in another place. Is that legal, public place ,smoking hmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Azbobbie0962
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the hotel, we were in the Presidents club, and I found the room to be nicely decorated with up graded furnishings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. While the hotel isn't exceptionally close to the main tourist sites, we were a short 15 minute walk to the zoo area to catch a city tour bus, which took us to the sites we wanted to see. As with most European cities, this city isn't necessarily car friendly, expect access to parking but it will cost you. Overall, I had a good stay, and would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars.... in the 80s”
Reviews.Author: Zswiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. While the staff was extremely friendly, the hotel itself is a flashback to the early 80s in every way. Mismatched, older furniture combining Tudor and Chinese elements. The rooms were pretty small as well. Basically, for the same or lower price you can find a newer, airier and more convenient hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyagywonok
Reviews.Content: Located in the western part of the city a little bit far to get to the centre for sightseeing by foot. Although, the hotel itself is really nice, especially for business purpose. Pros: - decorated in its unique style; - attractive rates; - great three-course dinner served in the hotel restaurant. It was included in the rate and it was worth it; - free wi-fi, in-room safe and coffee making facilities served me well; - short-spoken but very effective reception staff. Cons: - it was a bit cold in the room (March), I tried to use radiator and air condition as well but it was still difficult to settle the desired temparature.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but not on the best spot”
Reviews.Author: jfd_groningen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonable, but not anything special. For business it might be acceptable, for a romantic weekend this is not the place to be. The hotel is located a bit out of the Berlin activities; there are hundreds of hotels in Berlin at nicer spots. Nevertheless, it is close to the gay area, so for some of us the hotel might be on a perfect spot. The breakfast is quite okay, but the restaurant for the breakfast is far too small and noisy and service is not always what it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort hotel in nice area and ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: carlosmatt
Reviews.Content: According to German hotel classification this should be considered as a comfort hotel 3 stars. It has pros and cons. Positive aspects of the hotel is its great location near zoologischer garten and close to U and S bahn stations. The double window makes any external noise to disappear. Service was pleasant and adequate. Price for value was good and free wifi. What i didn't like very much was the decoration, the bathroom and the wasted walls. A would say it is a bit oudated hotel like those renovated in the 80s early 90s. My conclusion is that If you look for a design hotel this is not the place to go, if you go for a weekend or short term visit to Berlin without high expectations, this hotel could well satisfy your needs.

Reviews.Title: “nice and reasonable hotel when visiting Berlin”
Reviews.Author: deryapa
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, comfortable rooms - friendly and helpful staff - all at a good price - easy to reach metro and attractions - easy to walk around neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Yemi15
Reviews.Content: Do helpful staff,very friendly nice location,very accessible clean room comfortable bed Dont bathroom smells

Reviews.Title: “Good location for city trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Lou80London
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean and in good location. staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to a metro station so its easy to get around to all of Berlin's sights. It's also close to Tiergarten park.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: TeadaCailin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business-clean and comfortable rooms, very nice breakfast with lots of choices, and it's very close to U and S-Bahn stops and shopping. Staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: mark_vesterskov
Reviews.Content: As the end to our road-trip through Europe, we visited Berlin, and booked two nights on the Hotel President. After spending a couple of weeks in terrific hotels in Füssen, Prague and Frankfurt, we were extremely dissapointed when we opened the door to our room in Hotel President. You feel like you have walked into a time bubble, with huge wooden furniture, brown toilet, and generally horrible, horrible decor. The TV is 19", and placed so that it can only be seen from half of the bed. Everything feels dated, including the fact, that opening the minibar only reveals an empty closet with a note "Vending machine can be found in hall". Am i in Berlin or in a Sudan borrough? The biggest problem is not the fact that there is a trouser press on the wall. Nor that the room has so little light, that you can barely see what youre doing. No, the biggest problem, is that whenever somebody in the room next door breathes loudly, you can hear it. Conversations in the hall, no problem, thanks to the 2" space between the bottom of the door and the floor. The internet connection is ticket based, and you can only use 200mb pr. session, then you have to login again, which is also pretty annoying. The staff is nice, but that just doesen't make up for the terrible condition of the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a nice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: UlyssePT
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights here in June 2011. No complaints. Basically what you expect from a modern 4* hotel. No wow factor, but the hotel is comfortable, clean and convenient. On a busy road, but our room was at the back (as most of the rooms are) and very quiet. Staff friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was fine, if unexciting. Did not otherwise eat in restaurant or use room service.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good room”
Reviews.Author: thezoo86
Reviews.Content: We spent here 3 days in May 2011 and had a good experience. The hotel is 2 blocks away from a subway station (Wittenberger Platz) and U-bahn in Berlin is very, very reliable, so we were happy to be close to the subway. The room was very small, but clean, and we found the mattress to be very comfortable. We didn't try breakfast because it was expensive, but there are a lot of small bakeries and breakfast places around, where you can have more and cheaper dining choices. All in all, everything was fine except our shower, which smelled bad after being used - maybe a piping issue. The bathroom was otherwise impeccable. Wi-fi access was covered by the main room charge, which was great; most German hotels charge extra for that. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to access Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Leeny03
Reviews.Content: Hotel and rooms are dated. Rooms are spacious. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is quite pricey at hotel. Many restaurants and grocery stores in the area. Great location. Bike rentals available at front desk. Berlin is very bike friendly. Beautiful bike paths and lanes throughout Berlin. Parking is reasonable compared to other hotels $14.50 euro's per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pmlr
Reviews.Content: So we went for a weekend to Berlin and booked this hotel because of its price, and reviews. When we got to the hotel, we were given an upgrade, which was amazing. The room was big, comfortable, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good, but a far from the center. If you want to go partying, pick a hotel closer to the center, because although the metro is really close, just to get to the party area, is like 20 - 30 minutes (but don't let this keep you from booking, a lot of metro and bus stations around). Overall, I loved it, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel At The Good Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Student_Couple
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located less than 5 minutes away from the U-bahn station, there are urban buses also. The staff is friendly and can advise where to joyfully spend the time. The minus that there are no German resaurants nearby, so you have to take a ride by the metro (one or two stations) to the Kurfurstendamm Strasse - and there are a plenty of restaurant for any taste. I liked this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel - nothing special but fine for city break”
Reviews.Author: bikesrule
Reviews.Content: Location: Great for West Berlin, right next to KaDeWe and close to undergrounds to access other areas of the city. Service: fine. Room: had everything you need. This room was good value considering it's location and standards. General business hotel really. Fab kebab shops if you turn right out of the hotel, turn left at lights, and walk down to Potsdamer Strasse for 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: KulturReise
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President is a great four-star hotel which offers incredible value. The rooms are spacious and clean. It is located just next to the KaDeWe, perfect for exploring this beautiful city. One would just wish that the front desk staff would be at least a little friendly... this would dramatically improve the hotel's rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Keen_Traveller91 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Hotel President in December 2010. The location was fantastic, only a 5 minute walk from the nearest underground station in one direction, and in the other a long street of shops, like Oxford Street in London! Be aware that check in is at 2pm, although the staff were kind enough to take our luggage into storage for us whilst we explored the area. Our well sized room had a huge window looking out to the front of the hotel, with lots of storage space for our suitcases. There was also a small table and chairs as well as a desk with a TV. I have to mention that the lighting in the room wasn't great, there were two bedside lamps plus a floor lamp and a light in the hallway, which was nice to create ambiance but considering we travelled in the winter when the days were short it would have been nice to have brighter lights. A small compliant, however it wouldn't stop me from recommending this hotel nor staying there again. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy, our fridge didn't work but we were out almost all day so we didn't need it anyway. If you book at ths hotel do be sure to check that your room does not join to the room next door - the walls are very thin and unfortunately we had very noisy neighbours that woke us in the night with their loud, drunken conversations. All in all this is a nice, well priced hotel in an excellent location. The area isn't too noisy but a short walk will take you into a shopping area and the metro will take you anywhere in Berlin. The room was a good size, the bed comfortable and the staff left a small box of chocolates outside every door on the day we checked out too which was very sweet!! I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Let Down By Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: On arrival for our 3 night stop we were checked in really quick and had our room upgraded which was nice. Our room which overlooked a small garden and carpark was spacious and included a desk, easy chair tea and coffee making facilities. The bed was a fair size clean and comfortable with plenty of pillows quilts and blankets. The bathroom had a bath and an amazing power shower. Complimentary shower gel shampoo conditioner and body lotion. Loved the mirror in the bathroom which steamed up except for a section at eye level! There were bath robes and slippers for use too. Our room was very quiet and at the correct temperature. The window also opened to allow fresh air. We had breakfast in the roof top restaurant overlooking the gardens. The usual bacon sausage eggs scrambled and boiled. You could order omelette mushrooms pancakes fried eggs etc although they were slow they were worth the wait. Also bread cheese ham meats fresh pineapple strawberries melon and cakes. The first two days were great but the last morning we arrived at 8.30am to find there was no bacon or eggs no bread rolls or ham or pineapple. I guess they had been busy! We requested more food but the staff were useless. The 'chef' kept disappearing in the lift to the restaurant downstairs and reappearing with 2 rashers of bacon? If we had of paid for the upgraded I would certainly be looking for a refund. We had an evening meal in the street level restaurant which was really nice. Homemade burger and hand cut chips which worked out to nearly £10 but well worth it and a dessert that was almost too atractive to eat! Top class service. We used the bar on the ground floor one night but it was too smokey the second night. The guy on reception was helpful with maps directions and taxis. We left our bags at reception after checkout. When we came back from our morning out and collected our bags the guy managed to drop my hand luggage..........luckily the glass inside didnt break. After telling them to be careful with it I would expect better from a hotel of 4 star. The lack of service in the roof top restaurant for breakfast on our last day really let this hotel down and the fact that after 2 days of going down to the front desk to request milk for the tea and never getting any is not good enough for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, resturant surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: cr7London
Reviews.Content: As others have said standard business hotel in good location. Rooms adequate but thin walls - could hear too much to much from the couple next door.Staff helpful and v pleasant. In addition to the standard fare the resturant had some interesting dishes using seasonal produce, well presented and very tasty. Also had a very nice German red wine (didn't know they existed)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Basic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethatoo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Hotel President for a few days over New Years. The hotel is perfectly located on a direct bus route to Tiergarten (about 10min or less by bus), and is also 5 minute walk to the metro making it a great base for exploring Berlin. There are also numerous restaurants with in walking distance, and several shopping streets are nearby too. The hotel itself is a 3 star by US standards. I had a single room, which was very small, basic, clean, with a comfy single bed and a very nice, ergonomic bathroom. Free wifi was a plus. The restaurant is also very good. The staff is very nice, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel in Berlin City (West)”
Reviews.Author: business_travelller
Reviews.Content: Hotel President is located in walking distance to the Ku'damm and KaDeWe public transportation close-by ( subway and Bus 100 ) ideal location for city trip and/or weekends rooms modern and nicely refurbished, spaceous ensuite bathrooms, very clean rooms located off-street are quiet and guarantee a good-nights sleep air-conditioned rooms - very useful for hot summer like this year breakfast options - from full breakfast buffet to quick croissant breakfast restaurant and service flexible and very customer orientated always a pleasure to be a guest in this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “average standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliusO
Reviews.Content: Clean, but average hotel, quiet. Just a moment to KuDamm Strasse and KaDeWe. U bahn station is very close. Parking was not included, quite expensive - 45€ for 3 days.Rooms was clean, the same in bathroom. Room was small, but sufficient. WiFi was free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, everything ok”
Reviews.Author: KatriinaFinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel twice in May 2010. At the first time the room was nice, bed was excellent and there was enough cafe in the room. Room service worked and staff were friendly. Breakfast was not so good. I'm a quite allergy and was not able to find enough to eat for 15€. 12 days later I went back and I was surprised when I heard I have been upgraded to the Presidential Club since I have been there earlier. The room was even better and the breakfast on 6th floor was excellent! Well worth the money. On both times the internet worked well. Next time I have a meeting in Berlin, I will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Orenb10
Reviews.Content: I was in President hotel for 4 nights in single room. As the original room had problem they changed my room to a double room on higher floor. The room was clean, a bit out of date though). There was a coffee\tea facilities in room (instant coffee only). The room was cleaned every day. Staff were freindly and help with all problem\question i had including of touristic questions. WIFI in the room (no extra charge!) was very important for me. Breakfast was very good but VERY expensive, i got a special price for Breakfast instead of 15 EUROS which i wouldn't pay that much. Breakfast included all kind of Yogurs, Musli, Scrambel eggs, chease, Vegtibles, Israeli salad (great!), smoked fish. lot kind of rolls and bread, fruit salad, sweet pastreis. VERY friendly staff in breakfast room. I would definatly go back this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather stay in a box on the street.”
Reviews.Author: fashionman
Reviews.Content: First of all, people in berlin are friendly. But not in this hotel. We had been travelling for the whole week in Germany, and had visited alot of hotels already this week. And were looking forward to spening a weekend in Berlin with my best friend and co-worker. By arrival in the hotel there was chaos in the Reception. No worries i travel 160 years i day i dont care. So up to the room, and it was like taking a trip to the 70s and without the glamour. Instantly called my friend on the 5th floor ( i was on the 2nd ) And he had just been in the shower and had noticed an odeur of death coming from the pipes. My room was 70's his room was newly redecorated but "hanging on" to the terrible things such as the bed for example. Thinking it could not get much worse i went to the toilet and found a zoo on the floor, small greyish monsters roaming free on the floor, so off the bed it was. While trying to sleep on what more felt like a wooden plank that actually leaned on one side it was quite interesting when i woke up in the middle of the night in panic as i thought i was getting pushed down on the floor my a lunatic, but this was not the case it was only the bed living its own leaning life. So coming up to last day, im in my room packing the time is 12:01 just about to check out, i know check out time is at 12. But at 12:03 someone is baning my door, i thought i was flashed back to 1942 when this girl around 18 years old were asking me if i was staying one more night since i had not checked out yet. Having only spent two nights in this hotel, i can strongly advise as an experienced traveller that do not stay here, pay 10 euro more and get a 10 times better hotel, berlin is full of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeA3
Reviews.Content: Close to historic downtown. A good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: xarisis
Reviews.Content: we went to berlin in november 2009.we had two rooms, one new single, and one twin in the old wing but defenitely as good as the single one for 58 euros each.A taxi from scoenfeld airport cost 33 euros.Free lavazza coffee , central location(kadewe u-bahn is 1 minute walking, supermarket also) clean and the staff very polite. Only negative that check in begins from 2pn and not from 12:00... definetely reccomend

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room, very soft bed”
Reviews.Author: yuliaT
Reviews.Content: The only problem I had in this hotel was that I found the bad very uncomfortable. It was too soft and my back hurt a little in the morning. Other than that everything was fine. The hotel has a good location, less then 5 minutes from U-Bahn station and about 7 minutes walk from the KDV and Berlin zoo. I got a room on the side far from the street and it was very quiet, but I think the other side may have some noise from traffic. Breakfast was nice, not the best I had. Staff was helpful, room was new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time lucky”
Reviews.Author: BrightonDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time approximately 3 years ago. On leaving we complained about poor service and also the fact that the radiator in our room (and it was in December) wasn't working. They responded to the complaint and said that if/when we returned to Berlin they would give us a free upgrade at their hotel to the Presidential Club. We returned for a 3 night stay this September '09 and as promised were upgraded to the Presidential Club. The room was bright and spacious with flat screen tv, great sized desk, huge comfortable bed and lovely bathroom and very clean. We were really pleased with it. Breakfast was wonderful. Great choice of food and very courteous staff. The hotel is very conveniently located just a 5 minute walk to Wittenbergplatz Ubahn station, and equally close to the Kurfurstemdamn and KaDeWe department store. For gay travellers, it's perfectly located for Schoneberg, one of Berlins' main gay areas. The hotels' fitness centre was small. It has a sauna, steam room but no swimming pool. Also there is a small 'gym'. Smart reception area, and elegant bar. All in all, were really enjoyed enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, location, affordability”
Reviews.Author: zwerf
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable, upscale hotel located about 200 metres away from KaDeWe and the Wittenberg U-bahn stop. It's an easy walk from Bahnhof Zoo or take bus 100 about 3 stops. The reception staff were efficient and helpful. The exterior is not imposing and the lobby is not huge, but don't let that deter you. It was a nice hotel, especially for the price we got. We had a good room (about 35 sq m) on the 7th floor. Standard kind of room. It faced the road but we didn't hear a thing because of the sound proofing. Highly appreciated free coffee on the 7th floor. Upscale bar and restaurant downstairs. Grocery store was nearby. Plenty of restaurants and bars too. BBC and CNN only. No BVN. Excellent high-volume, high-pressure shower. Fairly good wellness area (opens at 4), but the gym is not enough for a serious workout. Other gym is nearby. No false notes or letdowns here.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable room”
Reviews.Author: StCurz
Reviews.Content: nice hotel for an acceptable price. but nothing extraordinaer that would make this emplacement special. average roomservice. Wlan astonishing slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- great stay”
Reviews.Author: Brazen1
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was friendly. Room was nice. Air conditioning was great. Breakfast was good. Selection could have been a bit better. Enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Good Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Spadam
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Berlin, we wanted something central for a fair price. The Best Western Hotel President was exactly that. Upon check in (around 6 PM), we were told that no rooms were available for the kind we booked. Therefore, we were upgraded to a President's room. The room was huge! The bathroom was very nice, with beautiful fixtures and marble floors. The air conditioning worked very well. The bed was a King Size, and the TV was a new flat panel LCD with lots of channels. The location is pretty good... about a 10 minute walk to the big shopping area and partially destroyed church. The front desk staff were very helpful with suggestions on what to do and where to go. The late checkout time (12:00 PM) was very nice, as we had a train to catch pretty late in the day. If we're ever back in Berlin, we would definitely check out the rates at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Max86NY
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bathrooms are clean and updated, staff is nice and helpful and the location is perfect. Try to pick a room that does not face the front of the hotel because the avenue is noisy 24/7. It wasn't a big deal for me because it felt like home in NYC. We rented bikes from the hotel and I absolutely recommend doing this from either them or a bike rental place. Berlin is designed for biking and everyone does it! The hotel is close to tons of shopping, restaurants, sightseeing spots and not far from nightlife depending on what you are into. I did notice a building under construction right next door but they weren't working during the weekend I stayed there. Good place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Call it the 'OK Western'”
Reviews.Author: PickySeeksNotPicky
Reviews.Content: Price and metro-access were the deciding factor in choosing this hotel. It was ok, in the end. The hotel is a bit far from most sights, but well serviced by Berlin's excellent public transport system. The room was a bit shabby and smelly (we were in a smoking room), but it was probably the best we could have expected for a last-minute reservation so near to New Years. The beds were comfy and the room was big enough. The bathroom was suitably clean. Not everyone at the front desk was very helpful (one lady was completely unable to tell us how to get to the Reichstag). Another refused to help us. One employee, though, a young blond man named Aiko, was exceedingly friendly and full of suggestions to make the most of our trip. Perhaps because of the low price, many of the other guests seemed to be a bit rowdy, and recommendations for nightlife were to an enormous Irish pub, so it did seem like the hotel was accustomed to being a place for people to sleep after binge-drinking. For what it is, though, this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Schintzel
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for a standard room, and immediately upon arrival were upgraded to a better room, on the 6th floor. No special view from the window, but the room was very clean and quiet, quite spacious with a big closet and a desk. The bathroom was very well equipped and at a high standard, in European terms. A big plus: each floor is equipped with an espresso-machine free of charge; just make your own cup of coffee/tea and take it to your room as many times as you want. A real life-saver for those addicted to the black stuff, especially considering the price of coffe in coffee-shops/restaurants (!). The hotel also offers free WiFi. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, as well as gay-friendly. The hotel is situated at a prime location: a 2 min walk from Wittenbergplatz U-bahn station, and a 5 min walk from Motzstrasse and Berlin's primary gay district -- a big plus for gay travellers. We didn't take the breakfast at the hotel, so no comment on this issue. Downsides: - the room had only a single chair and a single couch; which makes it difficult for 2 people to sit at the desk together. - reaching Berlin center requires using public transportation (but is only minutes away). Overall - a great experience, and good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: DJM_Kingston
Reviews.Content: After debating the best location in Berlin from which to indulge our passion for walking tours, we settled on the Best Western President Hotel. Although we really couldn’t see much difference in the web descriptions of the regular versus “superior” rooms, we paid the extra handlful of euros and were delighted to find ourselves in a mini-suite with a separate TV sitting area, bedroom, and beautiful, modern bathroom. The hotel is an easy one and one-half block walk from the U-Bahn (subway) and only just tucked out of direct sight of Gedächtniskirche, the ruins of the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church and now a memorial to the destruction of war. It was our first stop on a day that included all of Berlin’s “must sees.” The only thing better than a day of exploring on foot, is resting those feet at day’s end over a cold pint. The Hotel offers a wonderfully inviting lounge off its main lobby, and a “happy hour” that made our refreshments as affordable as our room. We did not sample the higher-end restaurant also located off the lobby, choosing instead from a cluster of clean, affordable eateries located near the U-Bahn station. The Best Western President Hotel was a big part of a wonderful weekend spent exploring a remarkable city.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, functional accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Yellowtree
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, but functional and central location. Small bar, clean rooms. Fine for a business trip or holiday when you're not looking for a unique hotel. Central location, 5-10mins walk from Zoo/big shopping area, 3 mins to Wittenbergplatz tube. You can take one tube line direct to ICC if you're at a conference there. Steak restaurant just over the crossroads that the hotel is beside is good. About 25euros by taxi from Tegel airport, or take bus to Zoo and then walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Stian333
Reviews.Content: The hotel were located close to the "shopping street" Kurfurstendamm and Europas biggest shoppingsenter the KaDeWe. The hotels breakfast was nice, but a bit expensive, so its possible to make a better deal in one of the nearby restaurants. The rooms was a bit worn, and the one we had was quite small, but still ok. The hotel also had a so called "spa" and fitness senter in the basement, but it was so small and worn that we never used it..

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need...”
Reviews.Author: TeamUnch
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Presidential Club rooms and given it was a Best Western, it was definitely above standard. After having a very bad experience with Best Western as a corporation after problems with a hotel in Toronto, I never use this chain. However, a work function required me to stay here so I gave it another chance. The room was not large (so would not necessarily want to imagine the rooms that are not the "upgraded" version) but as could be expected in this part of EU, very effectively and efficiently designed! North American designers could learn a few things here about the size of our footprints! The room had everything you would expect in a 4 star room--free wireless, a comfortable reading area, nice desk/workspace, flatscreen, separate bar area, very clean and updated bathroom, nice bedding, and little make up table/extra mirror area in a much smaller space than North American hotel rooms that somehow did not feel crowded at all! Breakfast was great and made life easier than finding a place nearby before work meetings (especially since it rained the whole time). Location was super convenient to U-bahn--although there were more interesting areas of Berlin, this area had everything you needed in terms of cafes, shops, etc without the hard core night club scene and noise. We were here during Euro Cup so crowds at night were fun and spirited all over the city--but not obnoxious or worrisome! People often try to judge based on the star rating--I have found from travelling all over the world, that this system is too diffcult to ever be useful. A four star in Mexico is completely different than the lap of luxury you find in a four star in Thailand or a four star in Jordan. This is by no means a hip boutique hotel, but it is better than a standard hotel (especially given that it is a chain!) Staff were efficient and friendly, but it wasn't the type of higher-end service you find in many other places (eg. no one offers to help with luggage or order you a taxi without you standing in line to ask them, etc, which are fairly standard courtesies in many other hotels....but are hardly an issue or problem). There was nothing significant that I would change here and I would recommend this to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: norwayguru
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Good standard, althought rooms are a bit small. Complimentary shoe shining service. Good breakfast. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverskater
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and found the hotel to be practical, efficient, comfortable and the staff helpful when asked. The hotel was well situated for us. Would I go back? Yes, but there may be better deals on the day that might tempt me away. This hotel knows how to charge.

Reviews.Title: “close to Kurfüstendam, all which is needed”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: close to Kurfürstendam the main shopping street of Berlin, close to subway, perfect location and quiet as well. Nothing to complain, real perfect hotel. Very good value for money. Great brasserie on the other side of the street for great breakfast cheaper then the hotel one

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Surprise”
Reviews.Author: RoisinDubh
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel 2 hours before check in time, we got a lovely greeting, saying the room was ready and they had upgraded us as we were there to celebrate our wedding anniversary. (I had written to them) We had a lovely room with Red Roses and rose petals, roses and candles also in the bathroom. Coffee could be ordered at any time at no charge, but I would still prefer the coffee maker in the room. A charming girl turned down the bed each night and left little sweets. The Hotel was very convenient to the underground and very near the famous store Ka De We. We were there for a week and spent the first 3 days on walking tours which were excellent. On the Saturday we went up the main shopping street near the hotel, there was a great buzz. The tour group Berlin Original Walking Tours were very informative, they also run a Pub Crawl and nothing would do but for my husband to go on it. So off we went with all the young backpackers including a young lad from our home town in Ireland. (Could you go anywhere without meeting someone from home?) Now when I tell you my husband has just retired and it was our 43rd wedding anniversary we were celebrating, you might wonder how we got on. It was FANTASTIC great fun lovely people and the night club at the end of the night!!!! The next day (3o’clock) all we were able for was the long promised visit to the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe. That is something not to be missed and you need a good few hours to take it all in. It really gives you food for thought. All in all we had a wonderful visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SJWalker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend break. Excellent location, 5 minutes walk from the Wittenbergplatz tube station, and right on the corner of the Kurfurstendammstrasse (the main shopping area, with the huge department store KaDeWe on it). As it was a weekend, the hotel dining room was very busy on Sat/Sun morning, and too small for the number of guests trying to get around the buffest tables, but it was fine on the Monday. The breakfast selection was excellent, with a wide choice to suit all tastes and appetites. The staff were very friendly, though rushed. The Germans haven't embraced our hatred of smoking yet, so the very nice (though small) bar was a smoking area, with no alternative no-smoking facility. Also, as usual in an hotel, the drinks were not exactly cheap, so we bought wine from the nearby supermarket after the 1st night, and kept it in the room fridge. The room was small but had everything we needed, cleaned each day, comfy beds, but awful pillows, we had 2 each, and they were useless - far too thin. Upon arrival at Schonefeld Airport, don't pay E30 for a taxi, take the S9 train to Warschauerstrasse (big station), then the tube to your own tube station. This costs E2.10, lasts 2 hours, but we bought a 3 day ticket for E19.90 each, for travel on all Berlin public transport, which was very good value. However, everything is a lot closer than it appears on the map, and we did a lot of walking, with plenty of watering holes to keep us refreshed. The city bus tour, costing about E20, was very informative, and helped you get your bearings, and work out what you wanted to see. You can get on and off whenever you want, to save on the shoe leather. Lots to see and do in this city, loads of museums, the Checkpoint Charlie one is a must. Be aware that there are large queues for the most popular attractions, such as the Reichstag, the Television Tower, so go early. The street food stalls and bakeries are plentiful and good value, and the food is of a very high standard, the Germans all ate at them, so we did too. Overall, a good hotel, if you don't mind smoking, and a very good weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Better than current Western presidents!”
Reviews.Author: Acting_ability
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Slightly away from the tourist centre (which can be walked to within 30 mins), but close to the park. Also close to the zoo area, which is quite lively. Found the hotel staff to be friendly. Not sure about the other negative comments on here - think standards may be a bit too high? Was a bit worried about the low price we paid, but was pleasantly surprised. Only bad point being on a main road, but when you are a few floors up it does not really matter. Compared to the hotel we stayed at in Munich three days later (which was twice the price), this was far far better.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: almg
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed for three nights in may and found everthing about the hotel very good. free tea and coffee all day nice touch . locaction excellent for shopping and transport . got free lift in hotel bus to airport on departure and as my husband left his jeans in room the hotel were very good and posted them to him would recomend this hotel great breakfast good value

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to President”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Callaghan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned staying at the Hotel President for three nights travelling with three friends, one of whom was German and knew Berlin well. I find the negative reviews of this hotel surprising. The four of us found the President a perfectly suitable hotel from which to visit the greater Berlin area, it is very close to the U-Bahn and the area did not at all feel unsafe at night. The rooms (we stayed on the 7th floor and had a good view towards east Berlin) were reasonably sized, cleaned every day and the en-suite bathrooms were also clean, with plenty of towels and plenty of high pressure hot water. The TV was adequate. The free coffee machine just down from our room was excellent, particularly when we discovered the close proximity of the hotel to the local supermarkets. There were also some good restaurants nearby. The hotel staff were v friendly and most obliging and spoke English. The buffet breakfast was a bit expensive at €14.00 per person, but there was plenty of it. The fitness centre was a bit shoddy, but everything worked. The hotel does have an '80s feel to it, but it is clean, safe and welcoming. All four of us agreed it was worth staying at again. The President is not a greatly luxurious hotel, it is probably nearer to a high three star than a four star rating, but it is suitable base from which to tour around Berlin. It was certainly better than I expected and much better than the worst reviews on this site suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading the reviews of the hotel. I booked the hotel through Venere.com at a very good price. Didn't go for the breakfast as there was plenty of places to eat near by. The Hotel looks a bit dated and is on a main road but I found it very central. The east is the place to be but we found it easy to get around from where we are.. Hotel was very clean and fresh towels and room service at your beck and call. Staff were a little muddled at first but incredibly helpful in the end, esp the conseige. The hotel is 200 metres from the metro and they offer a free shuttle bus and 24hr tea, coffee or hot chocolate, which we took advantage. Its a 4 star mainly because amenities such as a sauna etc. I think it all depends on what you pay..but I was pleasantly surprised and will stay here again. Janinne. London

Reviews.Title: “it really maybe presidential but only on ONE floor”
Reviews.Author: ericparis
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, Just spent 2 nights at the President with my wife. Just an average hotel in a poor location. We got assigned a very little room at first and after complaining at the desk we got upgraded to a nicer floor in a somewhat renovated room. I think the fact that I speak German helped a great deal. Same really small bathroom though. Cable TV wasn't working properly. Breakfast is good but otherwise nothing really nice to write about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You deserve better, believe me...”
Reviews.Author: sweettulsa
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the breakfast. But it actually takes a little more to get a good rating from the guests! Here’s what I will remember: - Depressing location (didn’t feel very safe at night) - Small rooms (totally outdated, bad satellite reception) - Unhelpful staff (unable to speak English) - The “George Bush” business center simply doesn’t make sense (unless you are in Houston, TX) In conclusion, I would stay away room this hotel. 2 nights there and you feel more depressed than after 2 weeks on the road. Will do a better job next time before booking, or simply read the reviews on this website!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good review. But then I m not an alcoholic...”
Reviews.Author: fantasia112
Reviews.Content: I found it highly suspicious that the only great comment about the hotel was that the bar was reopened for guests (see below).The access to alcohol is NOT what should determine a 5 star hotel rating. Unfortunately for me, I stayed for 2 nights at the President Hotel, only to find out that the negative reviews posted on your site were accurate and true! The location is bad, unless you like to rely heavily on taxis (I don't). The staff should take classes in English and adopt the smile at least once a day formula. On their website, the President is rated as a 4 star hotel, it is NOT. Rooms need to be refurbished soon. My last night in Berlin was spent at the SAS Radisson. It is an amazing place, which is totally worth the 30 additional dollars (free internet, great gym and sauna, incredible mattresses, classy decoration). Stay away from the Hotel President. That's really your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? Got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel and it is like traveling back in time. Welcome to the 80’s! Well you sort of know which year it is when you find out that their business center (second floor) is called …the George Bush room. That should make Democrats feel at home right away. Don’t expect anything other than rooms with basic comfort and very small bathrooms. The view at least from my room: the express way but you have the choice of dark alleys on all other sides of the building. It is basically away from everything: nothing to do at night in this area which has a terrifying past. Less than one block away was the Judenreferat (department of Jewish Affairs) which under the supervision of Adolph Eichmann was in charge of the extermination of 6 million Jews in Europe. The building no longer exists and no ghost will wake you up at night, just your neighbors’ activities as the walls are very thin. Luckily enough I had an old couple next door who snored big time. Staff is helpful most time but not all of them speak English. Reading this comment you may think the management is able to compensate with great rates and/or an extraordinary package. Forget it! There is obviously no need for it as this hotel lives on the reputation of the Best Western chain. Only foreigners booking from their distant home country -just like me-get stuck here (No such a thing as free internet connection. It is available at an outrageous rate of …24 euros for 10 hours!). Still hard to believe, this hotel is supposed to be four stars barely making it to 3 according to my standards (I am a seasoned traveler). You will easily make a better choice by staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “fit for a president to stay”
Reviews.Author: lethallee
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin on a stag do last weekend and i must say i was pleasantly suprised how great Berlin was. We stayed at the Best Western President Hotel which is ideally located to all bars, restuarants, shops etc...Although officially a 4 star property i can honestly say that the service and attention by the staff is more like 5 star. Being a travel consultant myself i wouldn't hesitate in sending clients to this hotel. The prices are pretty good, working out excellent value for money. The Lobby bar is very well layed out creating a vibrant but relaxed atmosphere. Our rooms were quite spacious although a little strange in there layout with the bathroom in the centre of the room. The staff were very attentive and went out of there way to ensure we were comfortable during our stay. On our last night our group had arrived back at hotel around 5am and gathered in the Lobby bar. After some intial discussions the deputy mananger reopened the bar especially for us. Then when the morning cleaners had to prepare the Lobby bar for breakfast we were allocated another section of the hotel to continue our drinking session. I thought this was excellent as i know a lot of hotels would not go that extra mile. I am pleased to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near KaDeWe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff, located just steps away from the U Bahn and the most amazing mall in Europe KaDeWe. Great breakfast and they have special packages that include a special evening meal in the restaurant which is part of the hotel (very nice for the price). I'll stay there next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not especially inexpensive, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LyonZ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel President is located about three minutes on foot from the Wittenbergplatz station on the U2 line from Berlin Zoologischer Station (one stop). Its location on the U2 line (direction: Pankow) makes it very easy to get to the Unter den Linden station (Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag) via Potsdamer Platz, Friedrichstrasse, and connecting service to museums and facilities on the Eastern part of Berlin. + Right behind the Wittenbergplatz station is the fabulous KaDeWe department store but just beyond there are numeruos shops and bookstores and restaurants along the Kurfuerstendamm leading up towards the Zoologischer train station. + The hotel itself has a full-service restaurant and a bar on the ground floor. Rooms are small -- single bed, shower -- but the ceilings are high and, with the help of a torchiere lamp, are quite brightly lit. The standard rate is about 120 EURO for a single, but if you look around (on the Best Western home page, for example) you may be able to track down a rate in the high 70s or 80s. A full range of amenities is offered (toothbrush, comb, hair tonic, cotton buds) but the water pressure in the shower could have been a little stronger.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel President
HotelInfo.Address: An Der Urania 16-18, 10787 Berlin, Germany
